components.description:
A face with small, open eyes, open frown, raised eyebrows, and a pale blue forehead, as if experiencing a cold flash.

While intended to represent fear (less intense than ðŸ˜± Face Screaming in Fear), it also conveys a wide variety of emotions, including feeling amazed, shocked, sad, upset, and cold. Bears the same expression as ðŸ˜§ Anguished Face on most platforms.

Unlike other vendors, Huawei's design shows this emoji holding a hand over its mouth, albeit differently to ðŸ«¢ Face with Open Eyes and Hand Over Mouth and ðŸ¤­ Face with Hand Over Mouth. Samsung’s design previously showed upper teeth and tongue.
components.title: Fearful Face

title: Fearful Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: A face with wide open eyes and raised eyebrows. Appears to be shocked by a scary event. Fearful Face was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in  http://emojipedia.org/fearful-face/
emoji_net_data.name: fearful face

bn:00103348a: Thrown into a state of intense fear or desperation.
Thrown into a state of intense fear or desperation

bn:00096663a: Terrified; struck with amazement; showing signs of terror or horror.
Struck with fear, dread, or consternation
Struck with fear, dread, or consternation.

bn:00110036a: Feeling mentally uncomfortable because something is missing or wrong.
Experiencing or showing sorrow or unhappiness- Christina Rossetti

bn:00097890a: Causing fear; of capable of causing fear; scary.
Causing fear or dread or terror
Oppressing with fear or horror; appalling, terrible.

bn:00104538a: Affected by an impairment of normal physical or mental function

bn:00107231a: Easily agitated or alarmed; on edge or edgy.

bn:00093646v: (psychiatry) To cause a trauma in; as, to be traumatised by a childhood experience.

bn:00083054v: Surprise greatly; knock someone's socks off

bn:00082447v: To disturb with fear; to throw into a state of alarm or fright; to affright; to terrify.

bn:00088065v: Be afraid or feel anxious or apprehensive about a possible or probable situation or event

bn:00094881v: To inflict someone with terror; to terrify.
To frighten greatly; to fill with terror.

bn:00033854n: An emotion experienced in anticipation of some specific pain or danger (usually accompanied by a desire to flee or fight)
An emotion experienced in anticipation of some specific pain or danger.

Fear is an emotion induced by a threat perceived by living entities, which causes a change in brain and organ function and ultimately a change in behavior, such as running away, hiding or freezing from traumatic events.
Uncountable: emotion caused by actual or perceived danger or threat.
Basic emotion induced by a perceived threat
A strong, uncontrollable, unpleasant emotion caused by actual or perceived danger or threat.
Fear is a basic emotional sensation and response system initiated by an aversion to some perceived risk or threat.
A content descriptor developed by the Pan European Gaming Information (PEGI) and the British Board of Film Classification (BBFC).
